name: Mandarin Chinese Language Trivia Quiz | Languages | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following is a common way to greet people in Chinese?
questions.explanation:
Ni Hao ma?.

	'Ni hao ma?' means 'How are you?' roughly....you ought not use the other three choices.

questions.text: How do people usually answer the phone in Chinese?
questions.explanation:
Wei.

	This is pronounced 'way'.  When you are in China and Taiwan, you'll hear it constantly as people walk by you with cell phones!

questions.text: How do you say 'thank you' in Chinese?
questions.explanation:
Xie xie.

	'Xie xie' is pronounced approximately 'shay shay'.

questions.text: Which of the following words has not been transliterated into Chinese?
questions.explanation:
Basketball 'Ba Si Ke Bo'.

	Basketball is actually 'lan qiu' in Chinese.  Though it's not a transliteration, the two characters together do mean 'basket' and 'ball'.

questions.text: If you want to show special affection toward another person, how would you express this feeling?
questions.explanation:
Wo ai ni.

	'Wo ai ni' translates as, 'I love you'. The other 3 phrases, well, let's just say...you won't be getting any kisses following their utterance.

questions.text: If you want to eat at a restaurant, be sure to go to which of these places?
questions.explanation:
Fan Guan.

	A 'fan guan' is a restaurant....they don't serve food at a trash can ('le se tong'), an office ('ban gong shi') or a library ('tu shu guan')...at least not regularly!

questions.text: 'Yi, Er, San, Si, Wu'....what comes next?
questions.explanation:
Liu.

	You were counting, and 'liu' is Chinese for six!

questions.text: In Chinese, there are different ways of referring to each type of family member (i.e. older brother, grandmother on your mother's side, etc.).
questions.explanation:
True.

	One of the joys of learning Chinese is figuring out all the terms for relatives!

questions.text: In case you were wondering, the name 'Beijing' means what?
questions.explanation:
Northern Capital.

	'Beijing' means 'northern capital' as opposed to 'Nanjing', which is the southern capital.

questions.text: Goodbye, thanks for taking this quiz....or in Chinese you would say what?
questions.explanation:
Zai Jian.

	'Zai Jian' and 'xie xie', I hope you enjoyed the quiz!
